title: Andy Ruiz Jr reacts to Anthony Joshua slimming down for rematch
text:
Joshua wants to slim down for the rematch (Picture: Getty)

Andy Ruiz Jr believes Anthony Joshua has given away his game plan for their rematch with his attempts to slim down.

Joshua has cut a visibly leaner figure in camp ahead of the second fight after being accused of being under-prepared and over-weight for his first encounter with Ruiz Jr last June.

Ruiz Jr himself plans to lose 10 pounds and was asked what he thought about his rival attempting to shed some muscle before their fight.

‘He looks a little slimmer, but I don’t think that’s going to do any different. You can do whatever you want outside of the ring, but inside of the ring when it’s fight time, like Mike Tyson said, everyone has a plan until you get hit,’ Ruiz Jr said.

‘He’s going to try and win by points, especially since he’s going to be running around.

‘My job is to cut the ring, and that’s exactly what we’ve been training for.

‘I don’t really worry about what he’s doing, you know. We have to worry about what we’re doing. He has to train hard.

‘I feel that he has more pressure than I do. I just have to do what I have to do, and just let my hands go and focus.

‘He even said at one of the press conferences, he said that he was gonna be boxing around.

Ruiz Jr thinks AJ is giving his game plan away (Picture: Getty)

‘He kinda told me his strategy, but whatever he does we’re gonna do the best we can to do our thing.

‘I think the main thing I’ve gotta do is just let my hands go and throw my combinations.’

Much has been made of Ruiz Jr and Joshua’s body transformations in recent weeks, but the Mexican insisted he isn’t planning any drastic changes.

He said: ‘I kind of wanted to be a little heavier because Anthony Joshua’s big. I wanted to carry his weight, take the punches well but I think being 10lbs lighter, I’m going to be a better fighter.’
